did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.
did.abstract: The collection contains student notes from l'Ecole Polytechnique Federale de Zurich, drawings and accompanying notes for an exhibition design of two pavilions at Saffa 58, 10 map-case folders of Saffa 58 drawings, a large drawing of Zurich, and 2 drawings of Chalet Meleria in Valmont dated 1952.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the Claire Rufer-Eckmann Architectural Collection must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Claire Rufer-Eckmann Architectural Collection, Ms1998-018 - Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The Claire Rufer-Eckmann Architectural Collection was donated to Special Collections in 1998.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: Claire Rufer-Eckmann was born in 1914 in Wabern, Switzerland and died in 1973 in Bern. She was a practicing architect who studied under Alvar Aalto in Finland, and also studied in the United States and Sweden.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection contains 1 box of 6 folders with student notes from her studies at l'Ecole Polytechnique Federale de Zurich. 10 folders consisting of 46 architectural drawings, 10 pages of accompanying notes, designs of two pavilions, 8 Saffa drawings, a large drawing of Zurich, and two drawings of Chalet Meleria in Valmont.
